responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Insecure External Entity Resolution
    analysis: |
      The code contains a vulnerability in the XML entity resolution process, allowing XML External Entity (XXE) attacks. By manipulating XML data sent to the server, an attacker can exploit this to perform actions like reading arbitrary files from the server, or perform denial of service attacks by sending payloads that lead to excessive resource consumption. The issue arises because the system processes XML input with a parser configured to resolve external entities, without properly sanitizing the input or disabling external entities.
    cwe: CWE-611
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/au/com/centrumsystems/hudson/plugin/buildpipeline/extension/FilteredVariablesHeader.java
      - src/main/java/au/com/centrumsystems/hudson/plugin/buildpipeline/extension/ParametersActionHeader.java
      - src/main/java/au/com/centrumsystems/hudson/plugin/buildpipeline/extension/BuildVariablesHeader.java
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Insecure External Entity Resolution
leads.analysis: The code contains a vulnerability in the XML entity resolution process, allowing XML External Entity (XXE) attacks. By manipulating XML data sent to the server, an attacker can exploit this to perform actions like reading arbitrary files from the server, or perform denial of service attacks by sending payloads that lead to excessive resource consumption. The issue arises because the system processes XML input with a parser configured to resolve external entities, without properly sanitizing the input or disabling external entities.
